author: @SkielCast
text: The CSV method can be tweak a little bit with the Zip function with the unzip feature, avoid using a for loop and the list declaration like this:  Instead of: X = [] Y = []  with open(filename) as csvfile:     plots = csv.reader(csvfile,delimiter=',')     for row in plots:         X.append(int(row[0]))         Y.append(int(row[1]))  We can do: with open(filename) as csvfile:     plots = csv.reader(csvfile,delimiter=',')     X, Y = zip(*plots)
